clinical_study.brief_title: The Validity of Modern Mobile Applications in Management of COVID-19 Home Isolation Patients: a Survey for Health Care Professionals
clinical_study.official_title: The Validity of Modern Mobile Applications in Management of COVID-19 Home Isolation Patients: a Randomized Survey for Health Care Professionals

brief_summary.textblock: In late 2019, a novel coronavirus, SARS-CoV-2, was identified as the causative agent of a cluster of pneumonia cases (COVID-19) in Wuhan, China. Clinical symptoms of COVID-19 may be mild or severe. The location where a person will self-isolate will be determined by their healthcare provider and their health authority. When determining the location, several factors to determine the suitability of the home setting are described as the case should stay in a room of their own so that they can be isolated from other household members. The rapid increase and evolution of modern mobile applications for communication and messaging for personal purposes have proved great benefit in healthcare management

primary_outcome.measure: rate of reassurance delivered from doctors to patients through Whatsapp

clinical_study.condition: the Use of Modern Technology Applications in Home Isolation

intervention.description: to assess and validate how healthcare professionals can trigger or inhibit the use of modern technology applications in home isolation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthcare professionals in Ain Shams University, Cairo, Egypt.
Exclusion Criteria:
- junior Staff
